result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant will comply with all federal, and state laws, and local alcohol, drug and violence ordinances during the period of this Agreement.  If there is a case charging a violation of a criminal statute or local ordinance pending when this agreement is due to expire, this agreement continues in effect until 30 days after such case is revolved.  If the Defendant is charged with a criminal offense in a case subsequent to the Court's approval of this agreement, a finding of probable cause in that case is sufficient basis for termination of this agreement. 
Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant. 
The Defendant will comply with and complete all terms and conditions of probation as to Count 2 in this matter. Violation of any rule of probation, or revocation from probation, constitutes a violation of this condition.
Defendant will pay a fine of $100 plus costs and surcharges as to Count 2, within 90 days of the court adopting this agreement, or establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts.

Defendant will undergo an Alcohol and Other Drugs of Abuse (AODA) assessment/evaluation no later than July 23, 2022 and will sign a release of information to allow the service provider to communicate with the District Attorney's Office. Defendant will provide a copy of the AODA evaluation to the District Attorney's Office within sixty (60) days of completion of the evaluation. Defendant will follow all recommendations made by said evaluation and will provide documentation showing completion/continued efforts to comply with said recommendations between 30 and 60 days prior to the end of this agreement.
Defendant will be truthful and accurate with the assessor and will inform the assessor of the current charge in this case and any drug or alcohol related charges in other pending or resolved cases. Defendant will provide a copy of the criminal complaint from this matter to the assessor for use in the evaluation process. 
If Defendant makes a good faith effort to schedule an evaluation to occur before the date above, but is not able to complete the evaluation by that date, the date for completion of the evaluation may be extended by agreement of the parties upon reasonable notice to the District Attorney's Office. Failure to notify the State of hardship in completing the evaluation prior to the date agreed upon constitutes evidence that Defendant did not make a good faith effort to schedule and complete said evaluation.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC.

9:41 AM Defendant Michael John Meller in court.  Attorney Stephen Robert Zuber in court for Michael John Meller.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Zuber- received information, has plea agreement. 
State- pleas to Ct 1 and 2. On Ct 2 30 days jail imposed and stayed in favor of 1 year probation. Conditions of 3 days jail, 3 days credit. Programming as per DOC. Fine of $100 plus costs. On Ct. 1, judgment deferred pursuant to agreement
Att. Zuber agrees
Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2 
Court questions defendant, finds plea is voluntary. Judgment on ct. 1 deferred pursuant to agreement. Warned to keep Clerk updated on address.  On Ct 2 30 days jail imposed and stayed in favor of 1 year probation. Conditions of 3 days jail, 3 days credit. Programming as per DOC. Fine of $100 plus costs. Apply bail.

No contact with victim 1 or the address listed in the ID Key, no use or possession of alcohol, no going to places where the primary service is serving alcohol, and must update the Clerk of Court of address within 24 hours upon release.

03:33 PM Defendant Michael J Meller in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman for a special appearances  Defendant Michael J Meller in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court amends complaint to show defendant's middle name is John. Court advises Defendant of his rights to consult counsel. Court acknowledges Attorney Hoffman could represent defendant as special counsel for the purposes of today's hearing. Defendant would like Attorney Hoffman for today's hearing. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading, plea to Count 2 is not guilty and ask for Preliminary hearing on Count 1. Court will accept the plea of not guilty on the misdemeanor charge and will set for Preliminary hearing on Count 1. States request on bail: $1000 cash bail with conditions of no contact with victim 1 or the address listed on the ID Key, no use or possession of alcoholic beverages. Defendant does not have any prior criminal history in Wisconsin or Minnesota, State asserts the cash is based on the allegations of the case and the victim is a child. 
Atty Hoffman questions Defendant regarding bail. Defendant has lived at the address for about 15 years. Defendant has strong family ties to this area. Defendant does have local employement. Defendant does have access to money towards bail. Atty is requesting high signature bond.
Court does have concerns regarding the allegations against a child. Court Orders $1000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with victim 1 or the address listed in the ID Key, no use or possession of alcohol, no going to places where the primary service is serving alcohol, and must update the Clerk of Court of address within 24 hours upon release. Defendant would like to apply for a public defender. Court acknowledges text message reminder slip to defendant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
